metadata.title: CVE-2024-50285 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:ksmbd: check outstanding simultaneous SMB operationsIf Client send simultaneous SMB operations to ksmbd, It exhausts too muchmemory through the "ksmbd_work_cache‚Äù. It will cause OOM issue.ksmbd has a credit mechanism but it can't handle this problem. This patchadd the check if it exceeds max credits to prevent this problem by assumingthat one smb request consumes at least one credit.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
